guide.readmeRaw:
# Node.js Installation Guide

JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine. Essential for running JavaScript applications on servers.

## Prerequisites

- Linux system (Ubuntu/Debian, RHEL/CentOS/Fedora, or Arch)
- curl or wget for downloading packages

## Installation

### Using NVM (Recommended)
```bash
# Install NVM
curl -o- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nvm-sh/nvm/v0.35.3/install.sh | bash
source ~/.bashrc

# Install latest Node.js
nvm install node
nvm use node

# Install LTS version
nvm install --lts
nvm use --lts

# Install specific version
nvm install v18.17.0
nvm use v18.17.0
```

### System Package Installation

#### Ubuntu/Debian
```bash
# Install build essentials
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install -y build-essential

# Add NodeSource repository
curl -sL https://deb.nodesource.com/setup_18.x | sudo -E bash -
sudo apt-get install -y nodejs
```

#### RHEL/CentOS/Fedora
```bash
# Install development tools
sudo yum groupinstall 'Development Tools'

# Add NodeSource repository  
curl -sL https://rpm.nodesource.com/setup_18.x | sudo bash -
sudo yum install -y nodejs npm
```

#### Arch Linux
```bash
# Install from official repositories
sudo pacman -S nodejs npm
```

## Configuration

### NGINX Proxy Setup
```bash
# Create NGINX configuration
sudo tee /etc/nginx/sites-available/nodejs-app > /dev/null <<EOF
server {
    listen 80;
    server_name your-domain.com;
    
    location / {
        proxy_pass http://localhost:3000;
        proxy_http_version 1.1;
        proxy_set_header Upgrade \$http_upgrade;
        proxy_set_header Connection 'upgrade';
        proxy_set_header Host \$host;
        proxy_cache_bypass \$http_upgrade;
        proxy_set_header X-Real-IP \$remote_addr;
        proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For \$proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
        proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto \$scheme;
    }
}
EOF

# Enable site
sudo ln -s /etc/nginx/sites-available/nodejs-app /etc/nginx/sites-enabled/
sudo nginx -t && sudo systemctl restart nginx
```

### SystemD Service
```bash
# Create systemd service for your app
sudo tee /etc/systemd/system/myapp.service > /dev/null <<EOF
[Unit]
Description=Node.js App
After=network.target

[Service]
Type=simple
User=www-data
WorkingDirectory=/path/to/your/app
ExecStart=/usr/bin/node app.js
Restart=on-failure
RestartSec=10
Environment=NODE_ENV=production
Environment=PORT=3000

[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target
EOF

# Enable and start service
sudo systemctl daemon-reload
sudo systemctl enable --now myapp
```

## Verification

```bash
# Check Node.js version
node --version
npm --version

# Test basic functionality
node -e "console.log('Node.js is working!')"

# Check service status (if using systemd)
sudo systemctl status myapp
```

## Usage

1. Create your Node.js application
2. Install dependencies with `npm install`
3. Start development server with `npm start` or `node app.js`
4. For production, use PM2 or systemd service
5. Configure reverse proxy with NGINX

## Additional Resources

- [Official Documentation](https://nodejs.org/docs/)
- [NPM Documentation](https://docs.npmjs.com/)
- [NVM GitHub](https://github.com/nvm-sh/nvm)

---

**Note:** This guide is part of the [HowToMgr](https://howtomgr.github.io) collection.
